intro: Lathyrus odoratus var. carneus, commonly known as the pink sweet pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring slender, twining stems and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant colors and pleasant scent. The variety 'carneus' is distinguished by its distinctive pink hue, setting it apart from other sweet pea varieties.
